item.title: S&P 500 Set for Best Quarter Since December 2023: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks are wrapping up a stellar quarter at all-time highs amid signs of progress in US trade talks while hopes the Federal Reserve will resume its rate cuts drove Treasuries toward their biggest first-half stretch in five years. The dollar eyed its longest monthly slide since 2017.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: US Stocks Widen Rally as Traders Chase Gains on Tariff Optimism
item.description: US stocks traded higher as investors cheered progress in trade negotiations between the Trump administration and key partners as a tariff deadline nears.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Kniazhevich

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the Voyager Technologies initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. Voyager Technologies Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $319 million in an initial public offering, as it looks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher as Traders Weigh Trump’s Tax Bill, US Deficits
item.description: Gold rose, supported by a dip in the dollar, as Senate negotiations continued over President Donald Trump’s $4.5 trillion tax package.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan, Sybilla Gross

item.description: The situation in the Middle East remains delicate, even as oil — and gas — continue to flow. But for US refiners, reliance on supply from the region is not as great as it once was. Grid-scale battery installations in the US are projected to reverse their rapid rise. And look what’s happening with the spread between corn and wheat as intense heat batters Europe.

item.title: Rally Has Been Concentrated: Dudley
item.description: Katrina Dudley, Public Markets Senior Investment Strategist at Franklin Templeton, discusses the recent stock rally to all-time highs with Bloomberg's Matt Miller and Katie Greifeld on 'Open Interest.' (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Vodafone Launches €2 Billion Debt Tender, New Bond Sales
item.description: Vodafone Group Plc pulled in multi-billion investor bids across a multi-currency debt sale, the proceeds of which will be used to finance a sweeping €2 billion ($2.35 billion) debt buyback announced on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Ronan Martin

item.title: Fed’s Bostic Says Tariff Pass-Through May Be Slow, Persistent
item.description: Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said tariff price increases may be incremental instead of a one-time bump, which could result in more persistent upward pressure on inflation.
item.dc:creator: Jonnelle Marte

media:content.media:description: President and CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview in Atlanta, Georgia, US, on Friday, Nov. 3, 2023. Bostic said policymakers have time to watch how the economy is evolving and be patient when it comes to interest-rate moves.

item.title: Robinhood Tokenizes US Company Shares for European Traders
item.description: Robinhood Markets Inc. is joining the growing push to trade US equities on the blockchain, making tokenized US securities available to 150,000 customers in 30 countries, 24 hours a day, five days a week.
item.dc:creator: Paige Smith

item.title: US Diesel Demand in April Stronger Than Expected Despite Tariffs
item.description: US diesel demand, a closely watched measure of the country’s economic health, was higher in April than early weekly estimates, the Energy Information Administration said in its monthly report.

item.description: The Dutch government needs more time to assess the options for TenneT Holding BV’s German high-voltage business and a decision is likely to come in September.

item.title: EU Seals New Trade Deal With Ukraine as Tariff-Free Regime Ends

item.title: Chile Delivers Biggest Copper Output This Year in Tight Market
item.description: Chile posted its best month of copper production this year as the world’s largest supplier of the metal delivers some relief to tight global markets.
item.dc:creator: James Attwood

media:content.media:description: The smelting area, where the copper is smelted and then placed in molds and cooled, at the Codelco El Teniente processing facility in Machali, Chile, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. Copper extended its retreat from a nine-month high as sentiment in industrial metals markets soured ahead of new tariffs from US President Donald Trump.

item.description: Oil traders expect OPEC+ will agree a fourth bumper oil supply increase this weekend as group leader Saudi Arabia continues its bid to reclaim market share.

item.title: Politicians and Businesses Aren’t Even Trying Anymore
item.description: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.
item.dc:creator: Joe Weisenthal, Tracy Alloway

item.title: EU Firms Urged to Automate Trade Processes Before T+1 Shift
item.description: The European body charged with overseeing the transition to a faster trade settlement regime urged firms to invest in automation, saying that the switch to what’s known as T+1 will increase the attractiveness of the region’s markets.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ritchie

item.title: Fed Versus Trump on Tariffs Impact Will Soon Be Put to Test
item.description: It’s a widely held belief among economists that President Donald Trump’s tariffs will boost inflation notably over the next few months. But muted price increases so far have called that assumption into question, emboldening the White House and opening up divisions at the Federal Reserve.
item.dc:creator: Amara Omeokwe

item.title: Chile Peso Gains as Communist Win Is Seen as a Step Too Far for Left
item.description: Chile’s peso rallied Monday on speculation that a landslide victory for Communist Jeannette Jara in a left-wing presidential primary will make a win for the opposition right in November’s election all the more likely.
item.dc:creator: Philip Sanders

item.title: Canola Jumps on Demand Hopes After Canada Scraps Digital Tax
item.description: Canola futures climbed as much as 3.2% — the biggest intraday gain in two weeks — after the Canadian government said it scrapped a digital tax in an effort to restart talks on a broader trade deal with the US.

media:content.media:description: A combine harvester during a canola harvest on a farm near Brora, Saskatchewan, Canada, on Sunday, Sept. 8, 2024. More than 90% of China's total rapeseed imports last year were from Canada, totalling 5.05 million tons, according to Chinese customs data. The variety of the crop grown in Canada is also known as canola.
